alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 3:13PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Volusia County through 345 PM EDT... At 313 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over New Smyrna Beach, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Port Orange, New Smyrna Beach, Edgewater, Daytona Beach Shores and Ponce Inlet. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
